definition: (idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
to answer/to agree
reply/answer/return/respond/echo
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to ask

sentences.english: Wang An Shi drive this question not ask of ask a sentence to the lane of but not angry at all.
sentences.chinese: 王安石被这答非所问的问句给弄的却一点都不生气。
这听起来有些答非所问。

definition: see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]

definition: to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
irrelevant/beside the point
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
lit. to reply "don't know" whatever the question (idiom)/fig. absolutely no idea of what's going on/complete ignorance
absent-minded/preoccupied/inattentive/with one's thoughts wandering
questioning (a suspect)/interrogation
confused/disorderly/incoherent
(of speech) obscure/unclear/(of actions) vague/ineffectual
to lisp/unclear articulation/inarticulate
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
lit. a donkey's lips do not match a horse's mouth (idiom)/fig. beside the point/incongruous

definition: to ask a question, already knowing the answer
